alert.note: Alert for Eastern Rutland; Western Rutland; Western Windsor (Vermont) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Burlington (Northern Vermont and New York)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 23 at 2:03PM EDT by NWS Burlington
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of eastern Rutland and west central Windsor Counties through 300 PM EDT... At 203 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Rutland - Southern Vermont Airport, moving northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. Heavy rainfall rates are expected. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Ponding of water in low lying or poor drainage areas will be possible due to heavy rainfall rates. Locations impacted include... Rutland, Killington, Mount Tabor, Tinmouth, Shrewsbury, Rutland City, Middletown Springs, Wallingford, Mt. Holly, Mt. Tabor, Proctor, Rutland - Southern Vermont Airport, Bridgewater, Mendon, Clarendon, West Rutland, Ira, Chittenden, Plymouth and Mount Holly. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Eastern Rutland; Western Rutland; Western Windsor
